t: The Psalmist in Sickness Complains of Enemies and False Friends.
For the choir director. A Psalm of David.
How*pn blessed is he who considers the helpless; The*ln Lord*s will deliver him in a day of trouble.
The*ln Lord*s will protect him and keep him alive, And*ln he shall be called blessed upon the earth; And*ln do not give him over to the desire of his enemies.
The*ln Lord*s will sustain him upon his sickbed; In*ln his illness, You restore him to health.
As*ln for me, I said, “O Lord,*s be gracious to me; Heal*ln my soul, for I have sinned against You.”
My*ln enemies speak evil against me, “When*ln will he die, and his name perish?”
And*ln when he comes to see me,*i he speaks falsehood; His*ln heart gathers wickedness to itself; When*ln he goes outside, he tells it.
All*ln who hate me whisper together against me; Against*ln me they devise my hurt, saying,*i
“A*ln wicked thing is poured out upon him, That*ln when he lies down, he will not rise up again.”
Even*ln my close friend in whom I trusted, Who*ln ate my bread, Has*ln lifted up his heel against me.
But*ln You, O Lord,*s be gracious to me and raise me up, That*ln I may repay them.
By*ln this I know that You are pleased with me, Because*ln my enemy does not shout in triumph over me.
As*ln for me, You uphold me in my integrity, And*ln You set me in Your presence forever.
Blessed*ln be the Lord,*s the God of Israel, From*ln everlasting to everlasting. Amen*ln and Amen.
